    Day 1: Introduction to the CCR, and to R Day 2: Data Management, Statistical Analysis, and Visualization Day 3: High-throughput Genomic Analysis

    Day 1: Introduction to the CCR, and to R

    day_1.Rmd
    library(RPG520)

    Connecting to the CCR

    Essential R

    Variables

    1 + 2
#> [1] 3
    pie <- "apple"
pie
#> [1] "apple"
    pi
#> [1] 3.141593

    Vectors

    1:3
#> [1] 1 2 3
    id <- 1:3
month <- c("Jan", "Feb", "Mar")
sex <- factor(
    c("Male", "Female", "Male"),
    levels = c("Female", "Male")
)
    id > 1
#> [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE
id[id > 1]
#> [1] 2 3

    Special values – NA

    age <- c(27, NA, 32)
age > 27
#> [1] FALSE    NA  TRUE
age[age > 27]
#> [1] NA 32

    Functions

    sqrt(id)
#> [1] 1.000000 1.414214 1.732051

    The data.frame

    df <- data.frame(
    id = id,
    month = month,
    sex = sex
)
    df[df$sex == "Male",]
#>   id month  sex
#> 1  1   Jan Male
#> 3  3   Mar Male

    Packages

    • CRAN – more than 20,000 packages (!) https://CRAN.R-project.org
      • Use install.packages() to install CRAN packages
    • Bioconductor – 2266 packages for high-througput genomic data analysis https://bioconductor.org
      • First install BiocManager from CRAN, then use BiocManager::install() to install Bioconductor packages.

    ‘Tidy’ data 

    library(readr)
library(dplyr)
    all_file <- file.choose()
all <- read_csv(all_file)
    all
